IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Pomfret School is a college preparatory boarding and day school for boys and girls in grades 9 through 12 and postgraduate. Pomfret School cultivates a healthy independence of mind, body, and spirit in its students as it prepares them for college and to lead in a diverse and increasingly interconnected society.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Pomfret School is a college preparatory boarding

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School invests its endowment funds to generate income and long-term growth. The income of which is utilized in accordance with donor stipulations, if any, and support of the School's exempt activities. The appreciation is utilized with the School's spending policy for the specified purposes of the various funds.

The School's federal and state Exempt Organization Business Income Tax Returns (Form 990T and CT-990T) are subject to examination by the U.S. Internal Revenue Service and Connecticut Department of Revenue Service, generally for three years after they were filed. The School's Federal and state tax filings prior to the year ended June 30, 2012 are closed. Management believes the School has no uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2016 and June 30, 2015, respectively.
Cost of Goods Sold-School Store & Tuck Shop $219,360
Cost of Goods Sold-School Store & Tuck Shop $219,360
STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY WAS PUBLISHED IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS. POLICY IS ALSO DISCLOSED ON SCHOOL'S WEBSITE AND ALL ENROLLMENT MATERIALS.
Assistance is granted on the need of each individual student.

The School requires the Head of School, school management and certain faculty members to live on campus as a condition of employment. Cleaning services are provided to the residence of the Head of School.

In advance of its filing, the Form 990 is provided via email to the School's Board of Trustees for review and comment. After the giving Board an opportunity to comment and any necessary revisions made to the 990, the School's CFO submits Form 990 to IRS.

Each member of the School's Board of Trustees is required to complete a conflict of interest statement to disclose any potential areas of conflict. Any conflicts would be reviewed by the School's Board of Trustees.

The School's Executive Committee reviews the salaries and benefits of the top management and compares them to surveys of top management of like-sized schools. Contracts are presented to remainder of the Board of trustees for final approval.
The Head of School and a committee of board members review the salaries of key employees and other officers and compare them to salaries of like sized schools.
All documents are available upon written request to the School and
